case_title: Smt. MOHINDER KAUR vs INCOME TAX OFFICER and others

accussed_details.name: Sardar Saran Singh (deceased)
accussed_details.designation: Partner, Atma Singh Steel Rolling Mills
allegation: Non-disclosure of business transactions in income tax returns

complaint_summary: Petitioner seeks to quash the proclamation of sale and recovery proceedings initiated against her late husband's property for income tax dues.
investigation_summary: Search and seizure conducted in 1972 revealed undisclosed business transactions of Atma Singh Steel Rolling Mills. Recovery proceedings initiated against the firm and its partners.
judgment_summary: The court set aside the orders pertaining to the sale of the petitioner's residential house and directed the respondents to first sell the factory property under attachment to satisfy the recovery. If proceeds are insufficient, only then can the residential house be sold.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition allowed. Impugned orders set aside to the extent of residential house sale.
legal_arguments: Order 21, Rule 64 of Civil Procedure Code, 1908
Ambati Narasayya v. M. Subba Rao, AIR 1990 SC 119
citations: Ambati Narasayya v. M. Subba Rao, AIR 1990 SC 119
key_issues: Whether the residential house can be sold before exhausting recovery from the factory property.
Applicability of Rule 86 of Income-tax Rules, 1962 and Order 21, Rule 64 of CPC.

maxims.Sufficient Portion Doctrine: Only a sufficient portion of attached property should be sold to satisfy recovery.

legal_terms.Certiorari: A writ issued to quash a lower court's decision.

words_and_phrases.Proclamation of Sale: Legal notice for auctioning attached property.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the recovery of income tax dues from the properties of the late Sardar Saran Singh and Atma Singh Steel Rolling Mills. The court ruled that the factory property should be sold first to satisfy the recovery, and only if proceeds are insufficient, the residential house may be auctioned.

impugned_orders.details: Proclamation of sale of residential house.

legal_references: Ambati Narasayya v. M. Subba Rao, AIR 1990 SC 119
key_points.main_submission: Recovery should first be satisfied by selling the factory property before proceeding to sell the residential house.

directions.factory_sale: Respondents to sell the factory property first to satisfy recovery.
directions.residential_house_sale: Residential house sale to proceed only if factory sale proceeds are insufficient.
